citRespParty.rpOrgName: Oregon Department of Environmental Quality, Water Quality Division

rpCntInfo.cntInstr: For contact on attribute Information: Karla Urbanowicz 503-229-6099

idCitation.otherCitDet: This GIS data represents the final version for publishing and public release.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This feature contains a spatial representation of streams and stream segments with water quality information from Oregon’s 2010 Integrated Report Assessment Database and 303(d) List as approved by EPA on March 15, 2012. This feature should be used in conjunction with the feature ORLakesWaterQuality_2010. A water body may have assessment information for multiple pollutants or conditions, and may have multiple data records associated with the spatial representation of the water body or segment of the water body.

Oregon’s 2010 Integrated Report Assessment Database and 303(d) List are available on-line at http://www.deq.state.or.us/wq/assessment/rpt2010/search.asp. The on-line searchable database should be used in conjunction with these features, and is the reference source to verify all attribute information about water quality and to obtain assessment information about water bodies that do not have georeferenced locations. Users may contact DEQ for information about Oregon’s water quality assessment process, additional updates to the 2010 IR, and the schedule for future water quality integrated reports. http://www.deq.state.or.us/wq/assessment/assessment.htm. This feature does not include additions to the 303(d) list that were proposed by EPA in March 2012.

A ReadMe file accompanies the geodatabase and users are encouraged to see the document for additional details.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: This feature spatially displays information about water quality in Oregon's rivers and streams based on Oregon’s 2010 Integrated Report Assessment Database and 303(d) List (as approved by EPA on March 15, 2012). , Oregon’s 2010 303(d) list is final and includes the 970 listings approved in March 2012 along with 870 listings added in December 2012.

rpCntInfo.cntInstr: For contact on Attribute Information: Karla Urbanowicz 503-229-6099

placeKeys.keyword: Watersheds, Oregon, United States of America, North America

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.2.3552
dataIdInfo.idCredit: This data set was assembled by the Oregon Department of Environmental Quality, Water Quality Division, Standards and Assessments Section. GIS data prepared by the Watershed Management Section, Drinking Water Program.

Consts.useLimit: Public data. There are no restrictions on access to the data set. This data set is designed to be used for regulatory purposes by DEQ to prioritize, plan, and develop Total Maximum Daily Loads (TMDLs) and water restoration activities, and as an information source for permitting point source and non-point source wastewater dischargers. The data set is available to the public as a reference and for water quality management purposes. DEQ recommends that all users pay careful attention to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. The information and data are provided with the understanding that conclusions drawn from such information are the responsibility of the user.

themeKeys.keyword: Oregon, water quality, water quality assessment, Integrated Report, rivers, streams, 303(d), water quality limited, pollutant, pollution, water quality standards, beneficial uses, impaired water

SecConsts.handDesc: Data is produced by state agency and is public.

upScpDesc.attribSet: Individual attributes contain description. Additional information can be found in associated tables.

Consts.useLimit: Public data. There are no restrictions on access to the data set. This data set is designed to be used for regulatory purposeds by DEQ to prioritize, plan, and develop Total Maximum Daily Loads (TMDLs) and water restoration activities, and as an information source for permitting point source and non-point source wastewater dischargers. The data set is available to the public as a reference source for information and water quality management purposes. DEQ recommends that all users pay careful attention to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. The information and data are provided with the understanding that conclusions drawn from such information are the responsibility of the user.

report.measDesc: Spatial Data: Water bodies without geospatial information are assigned placeholder LLIDs and are included in the data attribute table. The river mile at the Oregon border in some cases is corrected to the river mile from the mouth of the water body outside of Oregon. Streamlines are projected through bay, estuary, lake and reservoir shapes.

dataSource.srcDesc: Data Source Oregon stream water quality data attached to the 1:100,000 streams layer created by StreamNet (http://www.streamnet.org/online-data/GISData.html#hydro). Where stream segments were not present in the 1:100,000 stream layer, streams segments from the (USGS?)1:24,000 stream layer. In the case where segments were missing or gaps occurred, line work edits were done to provide stream continuity. A "stream" line was added to represent the Pacific ocean coastal boundary. In this case, a fictional latitude/longitude identifier (LLID) was added for GIS spatial and database query purposes. The addition of the coastal boundary necessitated a recalculation of river mile start and end values to correctly display mile values.

dataLineage.statement:
Every two years, DEQ is required to assess water quality and report to EPA on the condition of Oregon's waters. DEQ prepares an Integrated Report that meets the requirements of the federal Clean Water Act (CWA) for Section 305(b) and Section 303(d).
CWA Section 305(b) requires a report on the overall condition of Oregon's waters. CWA Section 303(d) requires identifying waters that do not meet water quality standards and where a Total Maximum Daily Load (TMDL*) needs to be developed. The Integrated Report includes an assessment of each water body where data are available, and the list of waters identified under Section 303(d) as water quality limited and needing a TMDL.

prcStep.stepDesc: Line work representing streams were reselected from StreamNet 1:100,000 river reach data files for Oregon for water body segments identified in Oregon's 2010 Integrated Report on water quality. Out of the StreamNet reach data sets ONLY those features in the 2010 Integrated Report are represented in this layer. The attribute scheme was revised for the stream layer to present the information contained in the 2010 Integrated Report records. Changes (additions, removals, modifications) were made to the GIS layers as needed to represent the 2010 Integrated Report information. In the case of the Klamath and Lost rivers, the line work was extended beyond the state boundary to facilitate processing. River mile calculation was based on the direction of stream flow and determination of the beginning and ending point of the line segments.

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Summary of Oregon water quality standard (may be numeric or narrative criteria) used to assess data or information for a pollutant or water condition. See geodatabase tables NumericCriteria and NarrativeCriteria.
Name attributed to a lake in the 1:100,000 hydrography layer. “Unnamed” signifies no attributed name. Local or alternate names may be given in parentheses. NULL field indicates no lake present.

The name of the coastal recreation beach used in EPA’s Beach Advisory and Closing On-Line Notification (BEACON) system for reporting pollution incidents for coastal beaches. See geodatabase table CoastalBeaches.
attr.attrdefs: Beach monitoring program, Oregon Public Health Authority, EPA Reach Address Database (RAD)

attr.attrdef: Longitude/Latitude ID (LLID) is a unique 13 digit code assigned to a water body. The code is derived from the longitude (7 decimal degrees) and latitude (6 decimal degrees) at a point at the center of a lake polygon. NULL field indicates no lake present.
Numeric identifier for an assessment unit segment. A segment is a specific location on a water body represented by an LLID and the starting and ending point of the segment measured in river miles.
The start and end of an assessment unit segment measured in river miles. RM 0 is at the mouth of a stream or the centroid of a lake. Miles are reported as: [River mile start] to [River mile end].
River mile at the end of water body assessment unit segment.
Numeric identifier for an assessment record with a unique combination of water body location (LLID, RM1, RM2), pollutant parameter, and season.

The name of chemical or organic wastes, biological and other materials, heat, sediment, and other wastes discharged into water. The presence of pollutants in water may degrade water quality and may impair beneficial uses of the water. See geodatabase table Pollutant.
Feature geometry.
Numeric identifier for a time period when specific water quality criteria apply or when data are grouped to assess seasonal water quality conditions. See geodatabase table Season.

Summary of data and/or information evaluated for the assessment. Field properties limit the size of the summary field and data in some records are truncated. See on-line database for complete summary information. http://www.deq.state.or.us/wq/assessment/rpt2010/search.asp

Action taken in a specific cycle of Water Quality Assessment Integrated Reporting. This includes adding new records to the assessment report for water quality conditions in specific waters, or changing the water quality condition reporting status for the record. See geodatabase table Action.
Numeric identifier for action taken in a specific cycle of Water Quality Assessment Integrated Reporting. See geodatabase table Action.
Time period when specific water quality criteria apply or when data are grouped to assess seasonal water quality conditions. See geodatabase table Season.

Numeric identifier for the water quality condition assessment category. Category 1: All standards are met. (This category is not used by DEQ.) (Status_ID = 11); Category 2: Attaining - Specific water quality standards are met. (Status_ID = 1 or 12); Category 3: Insufficient data to determine whether a standard is met. (Status_ID = 6 or 13) 3B: Potential concern - Some data indicate non-attainment of a criterion, but data are insufficient to assign another category. (Status_ID = 2 or 19) 3C: Impairing pollutant unknown. (Status_ID = 22); Category 4: Water is water quality limited but a TMDL is not needed. (Status_ID = 7 or 20) 4A: TMDL approved - TMDLs needed to attain applicable water quality standards have been approved. (Status_ID = 4 or 14) 4B: Other pollution control requirements are expected to address all pollutants and will attain water quality standards. (Status_ID = 15) 4C: Impairment is not caused by a pollutant (e.g., flow or lack of flow is not considered a pollutant.) (Status_ID = 16); Category 5: Water is water quality limited and a TMDL is needed; Section 303(d) list. (Status_ID = 3 or 17). Water quality limited or impaired waters include both Category 4 and Category 5. (Status ID = 3, 4, 7, 14, 15, 16, 17, and 20) See geodatabase table Status.
Information about Total Maximum Daily Loads developed to address pollutant, if available.
Additional information relevant to assessment.
River mile at the start of water body assessment unit segment.
